page.title: 11LAW AND ORDER/ROAD SAFETY
page.content: Sherborne Police Station always seems busy but there is no major crime in this area. Crime prevention and drug education is considered important. Finding missing children seems fairly common, but road traffic is the main problem. At least 3 policemen are on patrol all the time and do 8hr shifts. Sherborne is one of the safest places to drive_ because of lack of accidents the council find no need for a bypass. People are concerned as the night emer _gency ambulance cover is reduced. Tourists often go the wrong way up one_way streets. The magistrates court regularly fines drivers up to Â£200 for speeding, careless, and drunken driving. If people obeyed the rules no accidents would occur. Even though this rule is well known no one ever learns. It is mainly boys under the age of 20 who get fined for speeding.
